Shell hash dominated by Stirocolpus and Tawera , lesser Dentatium, Dosinia, Cominella.  Both adult and juvenile forms of Tawera.  Likely fall-in.  A well-rounded quartz pebble (8 mm x 5 mm x 5 mm) was found in the hash.
Shelly mud.  Matrix is mud but with shells as in unit above.  Likely drilling disturbance.
Homogeneous mud, with a trace amount of vf micaceous sand with rare small (<2 mm) shell fragments scattered throughout, dominated by Tawera.. Faint color mottling from muddy sand-filled burrows.

Homogeneous sandy mud, with vf micaceous sand with rare small (<2 mm) shell fragments scattered throughout, dominated by Tawera. Faint color mottling from muddy sand-filled burrows.  A sharp bioturbated contact exists at 63 cm depth in section 2, with common Stiracolpus shells overlying the contact.  Muddy sand filled burrows extend down 7 cm below the contact.

Homogeneous sandy mud, with vf micaceous sand with rare small (<2 mm) shell fragments scattered throughout, dominated by Tawera. Faint color mottling from muddy sand-filled burrows.  A sharp bioturbated contact exists at 63 cm depth in section 2, with common Stiracolpus shells overlying the contact.  Muddy sand filled burrows extend down 7 cm below the contact.

vf micaceous, calcareous sandy mud.  Homogeneous.  Increasing sand content toward base of section.  126-130 cm clay-rich interval.  Rare Stirocolpus shells throughout, but more concentrated at 92-100 cm, minor concentration at 80-84 cm.
Faint mottling due to presence of muddy-sand filled burrows.

vf micaceous, calcareous sandy mud.  Homogeneous.  Rare Stirocolpus shells throughout, but more concentrated at 98-100 cm.

Faint mottling throughout due to presence of vf sand filled burrows.
vf micaceous, calcareous sandy mud.  Homogeneous.  Rare and scattered Stirocolpus shells throughout, but more concentrated at 62-66 cm and 92-94 cm.
vf micaceous, calcareous sandy mud.  Homogeneous.  Rare and scattered Stirocolpus shells and some Tawera throughout.  Stirocolpus concentrated at 40-44 cm. Slight color mottling.
vf micaceous, calcareous sandy mud.  Homogeneous.
shelly mud with Tawera and Stirocolpus in a muddy matrix. Possible cave in.
v f sandy clay with abundant & scattered shells of Stirocolpus.
mud with a few percent micaceous v f sand.
micaceous, v f sandy mud with abundant shells scattered throughout. Stirocolpus dominant.

Homogeneous mud with trace amount of vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaeous.

Intervals of concentrated shell fragments, mostly Stirocolpus along with some bivalve (Tawera?) fragments (mostly small, few mm in diameter). Minor amount of vf-f sand also. Intervals are at: 33-36 cm, 58-62 cm.

Homogeneous calcareous sandy mud.  Sand is vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaceous.


Intervals of concentrated shell fragments, mostly Stirocolpus along with some bivalve (Tawera?) fragments (small to large , up to ~ 1 cm in diameter). Minor amount of vf-f sand also. Intervals are at:100-106, 109-118 cm.
Homogeneous mud with trace amount of vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaceous
Homogeneous mud with trace amount of vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaceous
Homogeneous calcareous sandy mud.  Sand is vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaceous.
Homogeneous calcareous sandy mud.  Sand is vf, well-sorted sand, slightly micaceous.
Muddy calcareous sand; sand is vf-f (mostly vf), well-sorted

Sandy marl, vf-f (mostly vf) with common small (< 2 mm) shell fragments and numerous sand-filled burrows (< 3 mm in diameter).  Shelly interval from 38-47 cm is mostly Stirocolpus with some Tawera fragments up to 1 cm in size.
Sandy marl, vf-f (mostly vf) with common small (< 2 mm) to large ( <1 cm) shell fragments.  Sandier sections are sand-filled burrows. Background sediment is finer-grained (mud).
Marl with vf-sand filled burrows.  Rare scattered small shell fragments.

Marl with minor amount of vf , well-sorted sand, mostly concentrated in 0-40 cm of section 5, with decreasing concentrations in section 5 and absent in the remainder of the core.  Most of the vf sand in the uppermost part of section 5 is found as burrow fill.  Faintly color mottled throughout.  Very stiff in sections 6 and CC.

Marl with minor amount of vf , well-sorted sand, mostly concentrated in 0-40 cm of section 5, with decreasing concentrations in section 5 and absent in the remainder of the core.  Most of the vf sand in the uppermost part of section 5 is found as burrow fill.  Faintly color mottled throughout.  Very stiff in sections 6 and CC.
